results.title: They used to call it sandy blight
results.creator_credit: Douglas Stanley and Nomad Films International
results.brief_description: Designed to reveal the problem of trachoma and other serious eye diseases common in remote First Nations communities. Health problems, housing and general living conditions are also looked at. Shows how medical attention can help to alleviate problems.

results.title: Women 88
results.brief_description: Women ‘88 is a series of seven five minute films. The series was produced for the Women’s Program Bicentennial Authority and celebrates and promotes the past and present quality of Australian Women’s achievement, so as to inspire pride in, and respect for, their diverse contributions to the evolution of Australian society.

results.title: Castleguard Cave
results.creator_credit: Syd Perov, Derek Ford, Haverand Productions and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An adventure film of a different sort - the fascinating record of the exploration of Castleguard Cave under the Columbia Icefield in Banff National Park, an exhausting but irresistible crawl through more than 5 km of dark tunnel, the longest known in Canada. What beckons the members of the expedition, what they find, how they support the physical stress, the nagging doubts, and what their reward is - these are all questions they answer in this film. Award: Milton Keynes, England

results.title: Nauru
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Australia. Dept. of Territories and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Presents life on Nauru, showing the people fishing, taming birds to attract wild ones, playing a ball game and wrestling. Phosphate, the only economic resource is shown being mined, crushed, dried and exported. As it runs out in thirty years, the Australian government which administers the island is planning for the future of the islanders - as well as exercising justice, educating children, and providing Australian scholarship. Includes the co-operative store, and the Local Government Council which Nauruans run.

results.title: Shades of Puffing Billy
results.creator_credit: Antonio Colacino, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Puffing Billy miniature railway runs between the towns of Belgrave and Emerald in the Dandenong Mountains of Victoria. Supported and operated by amateur railway enthusiasts, with the assistance of the Victorian Government Railways, the Puffing Billy has become famous throughout Australia. Takes a light-hearted look at the problems of operating the railway. An affectionate salute to the people who keep this little railway running and to locomotive enthusiasts everywhere.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Antonio Colacino, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Paddington lace
results.creator_credit: Chris McCullough, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Paddington is one of Sydney’s oldest suburbs, which has developed somewhat along the lines of New York’s Greenwich Village or London’s Chelsea and has become Sydney’s artist colony. This is a fully dramatised film, which captures the essence of Paddington, not only by striking visuals of the Old-Sydney architecture in the area, but by re-enacting the mood and lifestyle of some typical, bohemian inhabitants. Scripted by Joan Long. Music by Grahame Bond and Rory O’Donaghue. Starring Ross Thompson, Janne Wesley and Ron Blanchard.

results.title: Where are we heading
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Gil Brealey, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Dept of Health
results.brief_description: Presents an open-ended look at the effects that different parental attitudes to life and the family unit have on adolescents. Directed mainly at adult audiences, especially parents and community leaders. Note: Restricted to tertiary institutions, teaching hospitals, police and customs departments.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arch Nicholson, Gil Brealey, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Dept of Health

results.title: Week-end fishing = Weekend fishing
results.brief_description: A look at the various forms of fishing in Australia, from the crowded piers in Sydney harbour, to the quiet backwaters, inland streams, and rocky surf beaches. Men and women, young and old, participate in the recreation hoping to enjoy the fruits of their labour at their evening meal.

results.title: Watch your step
results.brief_description: The risks taken by the careless pedestrian. 85 of 100 pedestrians killed on the roads are responsible for their own deaths.

results.title: Viewpoint on Hobart
results.creator_credit: Barry Williams, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The city of Hobart, Tasmania, as seen through the eyes of European migrants. This film expresses accounts of prejudice and discrimination as well as the advantages of living in Hobart. Also included are brief sequences showing varied aspects of life around the city.
